author: m.kalinin
content:
This parameter is supposed to be changed as a part of client distribution change. A release of new client versions with this parameter set to agreed value is what we kept in mind while introducing this type of override. Though, clients may have support of CLI arg that overrides this value, also, note that CL client does also have `TERMINAL_BLOCK_HASH_ACTIVATION_EPOCH` parameter that must be set if terminal block hash override is activated -- otherwise, it won't work on CL side.

EL side must have `TERMINAL_BLOCK_HASH` + `TERMINAL_TOTAL_DIFFICULTY` overridden, and these two must point to the same block. TTD override in this case is also required because of EL clients specifics (EL clients has TTD as a fork trigger, TBH doesn't trigger a fork but whitelists the chain that EL is allowed to follow).

Considering the complexity of overrides on both layers I would supposed we rather have a release cut of all clients with correctly overridden parameters to avoid misconfiguration issues. It might worth having CLI args to make these overrides into tests tho
